an1.150:1.1: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain non-offense as an offense are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
an1.150:1.2: They make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”
an1.151:1.1: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain an offense as non-offense are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
an1.151:1.2: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”
an1.152-159:1.1: “Those mendicants who explain a light offense as a serious offense … a serious offense as a light offense … an offense committed with corrupt intention as an offense not committed with corrupt intention … an offense not committed with corrupt intention as an offense committed with corrupt intention … an offense requiring rehabilitation as an offense not requiring rehabilitation … an offense not requiring rehabilitation as an offense requiring rehabilitation … an offense with redress as an offense without redress … an offense without redress as an offense with redress are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
an1.152-159:1.2: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”
an1.160:1.1: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain non-offense as non-offense are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
an1.160:1.2: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”

an1.162-169:1.1: “Those mendicants who explain a light offense as a light offense … a serious offense as a serious offense … an offense committed with corrupt intention as an offense committed with corrupt intention … an offense not committed with corrupt intention as an offense not committed with corrupt intention … an offense requiring rehabilitation as an offense requiring rehabilitation … an offense not requiring rehabilitation as an offense not requiring rehabilitation … an offense with redress as an offense with redress … an offense without redress as an offense without redress
an1.162-169:1.2: are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of the people, of gods and humans.
an1.162-169:1.3: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”
